content.raw:
My personal opinion is that Gazebo Classic is “wrong” here \(using a subjective form of “wrong”\), because Gazebo Classic is not altering the angular velocity of the model, but rather altering the angular velocity of each link individually.

That behavior is likely to result in states that egregiously violate the joint constraints and may be hard for ODE or other maximal coordinate physics engines to recover from.

The new behavior ensures that users can’t ask for joint constraints to be violated, which should help keep simulations sane and stable.
